meanings.definition: A person who sets type for printing.
meanings.sent1: The typesetter carefully arranged the letters for the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The typesetter worked diligently to prepare the text for printing.
meanings.sent3: The typesetter joked that arranging letters was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The typesetter's precision in arranging letters was like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The typesetter's skill in setting type made the printed page come alive.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used to set type for printing.
meanings.sent1: The typesetter efficiently printed out the text for the book.
meanings.sent2: The typesetter was a crucial part of the printing process.
meanings.sent3: The typesetter machine hummed along, creating perfectly aligned text.
meanings.sent4: The typesetter worked tirelessly, like a silent worker bee in the printing shop.
meanings.sent5: The typesetter machine revolutionized the way books were produced.
